alert.note: Alert for Wayne (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 17 at 4:55PM EDT by NWS Detroit
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT EAST CENTRAL WAYNE COUNTY THROUGH 600 PM EDT... At 454 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Wyandotte, or near Taylor. The storm is nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Wyandotte, Lincoln Park, Southgate, Allen Park, Melvindale, Ecorse, and River Rouge. This includes I-75 between mile markers 40 and 43. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
